content.description: A great left to right arete climb. Sit start with left hand on the arete and right hand on the face. Pull up and move out right to a seam on the face that allows you to compress the arete. Make a couple hard bumps up the arete and then some fancy footwork and tension will take you to a large crack jug. Rest up for a hot second and figure out your next path up the arete into the same finish as “the big Finnish”. Really good one!
content.location: The left arete on the Finn-land boulder.

content.description: Sit start with right hand on the arete and left hand on a crystal sidepull with a crucial thumb catch. Pull on and make a hard bump up the arete with your right hand to a patch of crystals. Pray you don’t dry fire and find some feet in order to surf out left to a good sidepull, crux is over but there’s still a little bit of balance to top it out!
content.location: The south face of the “finn-land “ boulder, adjacent to “left Finn”

content.description: An amazing right to left arete climb on an aesthetically pleasing block. Stand start with right hand on the arete and left hand on the face on anything you’d like. Make some easy moves to get established, then make a couple tension moves along the finn before an exciting finish to a flat jug. Top out and enjoy the view! Really good landing but it feels larger than it is, highly recommend trying this if you’re in the area!
content.location: On the Finn-land boulder, the most natural line on the right side of the boulder that rides the arete.

content.description: This thin and proud boulder hosts two great arete climbs and a bulging face climb. There is potential for a line on the face too if you have the imagination for it.
